title: I propose a new game mode between the lower elo players and high elo.
body:
The idea is simple, the mode has 5 players ranging from bronze MMR to gold MMR on one team.

The other team gets 1 plat~challenger player + 4 beginner bots.

For every premade member, the high elo team gets an intermediate bot instead.

Let the games begin. :^)

-_-

Edit: due to popular demand, here is a list of community driven rulings:

* Towers and split pushing: High elo side gets backdoor plating buff on towers at all times except when the main player is on death timer.

* Gold bounty: Gold and experience gained from slain bots is reduced dramatically to combat farming abuse.

* Match making: A plat V high elo player shall not be matched VS players higher than Gold V ranking, that or the system adjusts MMR accordingly to mix in bronze 4 players for example.

* Winrate expectancy: The game mode should have around 60% winrate in favor of low elo team to encourage teamwork and a threatening challenge for the high elo player --especially for challengers and masters since they have ridiculously long queue times-- 

* Gold flow: similar to purple VS blue side adjustment to elo difference, the solo player gets increased gold flow if the enemy MMR is higher than it should be; exact values shall be found via trial and error while observing win-rate trends.

* Champion select: The mode shall have a blind pick with bans.

-_-

That is all for now~
I wish to see this become a reality. :)

I don't want to be mean but... this is a horrible idea.

Likely scenario: team with more real players wins every game. You saw this in Doom Bots even. It doesn't matter how impossible it is for you to beat the enemy in a fight, if you can force them to make bad decisions (lose this tower or that tower). 

Likely scenario 2: the guy just shits on a solo or duo lane while the others push to win. One person has a horrible time, most of the other players have no real interaction except him maybe showing up to kill them with all the gold from shitting on the one guy.

Un*likely scenario: the guy actually stomps all of the real players and they get to feel like shit? Wow new game mode so fun it makes people want to uninstall

*I'm silverish if you want to go by my ranked placements and I've beat diamonds in lane without jungler intervention and in games (but then there's a lot more people factoring in on it). The lone player could only win in two ways: his enemies don't know how to buy items, use abilities or what towers do, or he plays someone like Riven/Lee Sin/some ADCs (effectively manaless, good scaling, capable of using either Hydra or Hurricane + lifesteal) and snowballs to the point where he can 2-shot eveyone on their team. I do this to bots regularly when I want my first win of the day in a hurry. Snowballing in this game is out of control, but in the absence of that out of control snowballing there's no way 1 person can lose to 5 people who have the slightest clue.

This isn't difficult to balance:

1. Release game mode

2. Check winrate of both sides

3. If high elo side has less than 40% winrate, increase that side's gold flow & make turrets stronger until winrate is 40%ish.

?????

Profit.

But it's still *horrible* if it's balanced. A gametype that tries to say "hey you five people, hey, you're worth less than this one person" is a terrible terrible idea. Whether that's 50% of the time or 100% of the time. Either the 1 side gets the ability to snowball (which isn't remotely a measure of skill by the way, you could have it be one silver vs five silvers if you're going to give the one automatic snowballing) and they wreck 5 people, not fun for anyone but him, or 4 people push and 1 person gets stomped, not fun for anyone, or 1 person just gets stomped, not very fun for anyone.
